definition: any of a family (Lamiaceae synonym Labiatae, the mint family) of aromatic plants with a square stem and a 4-lobed ovary which produces four one-seeded nutlets in fruit, any of a genus (Mentha) of mints that have white, purple, or pink verticillate flowers with a nearly regular corolla and four equal stamens and that include some used in flavoring and cookery
a place where coins, medals, or tokens are made
a place where something is manufactured
to make (coins or money) out of metal : coin
to cause to attain an indicated status
unmarred as if fresh from a mint
